delete.summary:
DeleteCollectionJob API
DeleteCollectionJob is used to mark an collection job for deletion within collection based on Application Context.
Collection Service will clean up associated sensor configs on collectors or devices in asynchronously.
GetCollectionJobSummary can be used to track the progress and phase of the deletion. An Collection Job marked for deletion
will move from ACTIVE phase to TERMINATING phase , on successful termination , AppContext will be deleted from the
Collection service, if not CollectionJob will enter TERMINATION_FAILED phase ;Deletion can be tried again from
TERMINATION_FAILED phase where in it will move to TERMINATING phase.

put.summary:
CreateCollectionJob API
This API allows you to a create an collection job for a devcice set. An application sends a request for list of sensor paths
where path identified by a YANG model i.e, it could be native YANG path for the device such as
"Cisco-IOS-XR-infra-statsd-oper:infra-statistics/interfaces/interface/latest/data-rate" where the path identifies the
device OS type and YANG model on the device or  SNMP YANG path such as "SNMPv2-MIB:SNMPv2-MIB/system/sysName" or
OID:1.2.3.4 or CLI command such as "show clock" or Trap yang path "snmp-trap-raw-oper:traps/data"or Syslog path or
GNMI path in addition to cadence for push or poll .
The cadence that is specified in this request
can be over written by another application and is open to optimization, if other applications also request the same
path. CreateCollectionJob does a set of sensor paths configs within collection service based on application context
on a bunch of devices or a single device group. ApplicationContext is expected to be globally unique.
An application context could only be associated with one CollectType at a time. Recreation of application context
in NOT_READY state or TERMINATING or TERMINATION_FAILED phase will result in failure.Collection service tries its
best meet the lowest common denominator for cadence on a requested path across all services. A collection job's
collect type and device set is immutable once it is accepted into the system, on successive create calls, which results.
in update unless DeleteCollectionJob is done. User is responsible for specifying for proper paths associated with
collect type.
- DeviceId: Uuid of Device as specified in DLM
- DeviceGroup : Device tags as specified in DLM

post.summary:
GetCollectionJobConfig API
GetConfiguration
GetCollectionJobConfig can be used track the configuration request within Collection Service API. It will
return all sensor configuration and device set with their destinations.
 Application context is optional

GetCollectionControlStatusPerDevice API
Detailed Granular view of each device within a job for control status
GetCollectionControlStatusPerDevice can be used track a control status within Collection Service API over list of devices a job spans
over. It indicates control path state on per device per sensor has been successfully setup within helios or not.
Application context or device id is must  for this API

Get job count in system,along with list of input count,output count,error count per collection job if
collection job application context is passed. If application context is not passed , it will return
over all count of input,output,error in system across all collection jobs.

GetCollectionDataMetricsPerDevice API
Detailed Granular view of each device within a job for data metrics
Returns the data metrics from per device per sensor basis . Only last reported values is retained.
The metrics is driven is pushed on a cadence basis in the backend. Its on per device per sensor basis with input metrics from device to collector,
output metrics from collector to  destinations.If the collector does not any status , it might be an empty response.
 Application context or device id is must  for this API

GetCollectionDataStatusPerDevice API
Detailed Granular view of each device within a job for data status
Returns the data status from per device per sensor basis .  Only last reported values is retained.
The status is driven by on change notification in the backend. Its on per device per sensor basis whether collection took place from device to collector,
whether write took place from collector to  destinations. If anything failed in input or output, you would see
error describing the failure and state.If the collector does not any status , it might be an empty response.
 Application context or device id is must  for this API
Returns the overall state of the collection job based on counters.

GetCollectionJobSummary API
GetCollectionJobSummary can be used track a operational state request within Collection Service API. It indicates current status
i.e, READY , NOT_READY,FAILED .
If the Phase indicates
TERMINATING or TERMINATION_FAILED no create/update operations can be performed on app context. If phase is
TERMINATION_FAILED an app could retry to delete an Collection Job again. Once CollectionJob enters  TERMINATING or
TERMINATION_FAILED phase , status of the Job is no longer relevant.
 Application context is optional
Returns whether a Resource is in use . Currently supported resource is Destination id. Internal use only

SyslogSensorPRIs.title:
PRI is combination of Facility code(0-23) and Severity(0-7).
Empty list will result in all syslog messages getting collected.
If multiple items are present in the same list type, as long as any one matches, messages would be collected.
Three digit code that's a combination of Facility and Severity

application_id.description: Unique ID to identify your application. Crosswork Applications need to prefix application id with cw prefix.

context_id.description: Unique ID to identify your application subscription across all collection jobs. Recommended to use UUID.

collection_serviceApplicationContext.title:
ApplicationContext Unique handle to identify your application's subscription . Combination of Application id and context_id
should be globally unique

application_context.description: Unique handle to identify your application's collection job , serves as Key to Object on which CRUD ops are done.

device_data.title:
Device Set on which operation was carried out. ** NOT A SET, might want to put id **
Device data

status.title: Current Status of the overall job i.e, READY,NOT_READY,FAILED

phase.title: Current Phase of overall job, ACTIVE or TERMINATING

sensor_config_committed.title: Sensor config committed based on optimization

commit_state.title: Indicates whether target state vs requested was converged on the device successfully across all jobs

device_error.title: Any processing error encountered during commit

collection_serviceCollectionControlStatu.title:
CollectionControlStatus  indicating success or failure on a per device basis for a given job
ContextId : robot.collector.helios.collection.device.control.status

input_metrics_list.title: Metrics per device per sensor on the input collection side

output_metrics_list.title: Metrics per device per destination on the output collection side

input_status_list.title: Status per device per sensor on the input collection side

output_status_list.title: Status per device per destination on the output collection side

collection_serviceCollectionDataStatus.title:
CollectionJob Data Status from CDG Instances
ContextId : robot.collector.helios.collection.datastatus

application_context.description: Unique handle to identify your application's collection job , serves as Key to Object on which CRUD ops are done.

collection_mode.title:
Style of collection persistent or non-persistent
Note Recurrent , Transient jobs are not applicable to any collection that involves device config change

job_device_set.title: Job DeviceSet reflects a collection of devices or device group

sensor_input_configs.description: SensorInputConfig reflects a group of sensors and their cadences.

sensor_output_configs.title: SensorOutputConfig reflects a group of sensors and their destinations

collection_serviceCollectionJobConfigura.title:
CollectionJobConfiguration that encapsulates bunch of sensor configs across devices or one device group with an application
context

application_context.description: Unique handle to identify your application's collection job , serves as Key to Object on which CRUD ops are done.

creation_time.title: UTC Creation Time of the job as epoch time in milliseconds when request was created

deletion_time.title: UTC Deletion Time of job as epoch time in milliseconds when request for deletion was initiated

status.title: Current Status of the job i.e, READY,NOT_READY,FAILED

phase.title: Current Phase of Request itself, ACTIVE or TERMINATING OR TERMINATION_FAILED OR DELETED

job_error.description:
If the job is FAILED or TERMINATION_FAILED state, descriptive error indicating failure reason
Error if any. Its a summary .

collection_serviceCollectionJobStatus.title:
CollectionJobStatus represents current status of the job
ContextId : robot.collector.helios.collectionjob.summary

life_cycle_state.description: The actual collection job lifetime cycle state.

application_context.description: The associated unique identifier for a given collection job.

creation_time.description: The creation time (used as last modified time).

collection_serviceCollectionLifeCycleSta.description: CollectionState aggregate an application context to a State.

schedule_id.description: Calendar-ID: Calendar schedule to follow for CALENDAR_DRIVEN jobs . NOT Supported as of now.

n_collections.description:
Number of collections to run before auto-deletion.
Used only when lifetime_type is AUTO_DELETE_AFTER_N_SAMPLES.
Number of collections represents cadence cycle irrespective of out come of each collection which may be SUCCESS
or FAILED.
Only supported for collections where collector intiates the connection to device i,e, SNMP and CLI.

collection_serviceCollectionState.description:
- ACTIVE_STATE: Object is behaving as expected
 - INACTIVE_STATE: Object is in a bad state.
 - ACCEPTED_STATE: Object is under evaluation
collection_serviceCollectionState.title: Collection Operation states of an object

collection_serviceConfigurationCommitSta.description:
- COMMITTED: Control config for device was successfully converged based on target state
 - NOT_COMMITTED: Control config for device was not successfully converged based on target state
collection_serviceConfigurationCommitSta.title: Collection Configuration state

collection_job.title: CollectionJobConfiguration describing collection job with application context as key

result.title: Sync Request reply , indicating whether request has accepted or rejected

application_context.description: Unique handle to identify your application's collection job , serves as Key to Object on which CRUD ops are done.

result.title: Sync Request reply , indicating whether request has accepted or rejected

destination_id.title: Unique identifier for Destination Provider in Inventory

context_id.description:
Destination context identifier.
It could be topic name if destination is message bus.
The combination of destination_id and context_id needs to be unique for Destination. What context id
means depends on the Destination type of Destination provider.
If GRPC is destination type, context_id is not used and will be ignored.

destination_name.title:
Not used during Write, Optionally filled during Get API's.
Maps to destination provider name in DLM

collection_serviceDestination.description:
Destination identifier to uniquely identify a destination
Output encoding format for destination is derived from Inventory destination_id.

device_id.title: UUID of device in CW inventory

host_name.title: Host name  of device in CW inventory.Optional to populate

devices.description: Devices or Routers identified as UUID's in Inventory in Crosswork.

device_group.description: Device group id identified by device ‘tags’ in Crosswork.

collection_serviceDeviceSet.description:
Device Grouping Object , for a given request set one of either one of device grouping
i.e, list of devices or a device group not both. OneOf construct is enforced at runtime.

device_ids.title: Array of device_ids, refers to uuid in Crosswork Inventory

error.title:
Message is a textual description of reason for rejection, and can be safely passed on to operator through logs
or UI

operator.title: the filter logical or conditional operator ex. AND, OR, >, <

field.title: field to filter on.  Only CollectionState String is supported

value.description: field value to filter on.  Note for non string backend will convert to honor actual db type.

collection_serviceFilterOperator.description:
- UNKNOWN_OPERATOR: unknown operator
 - OPERATOR_OR: OR operator filter applied across filter list
 - OPERATOR_AND: AND operator filter applied across filter list
 - OPERATOR_EQ: EQUAL operator filter applied across filter list. not supported yet.
 - OPERATOR_REGEX: REGEX operator filter applied across filter list. not supported yet.
 - OPERATOR_CONTAINS: CONTAINS operator filter applied across filter list. supported only for hostname.

collection_control_status_list.description: Status of job over a list of devices.

result.title: Request reply , indicating whether request has accepted or rejected

application_context.description: Unique handle to identify your application's collection job , serves as Key to Object on which CRUD ops are done.

collection_job_configuration_list.title: CollectionJobConfiguration contains configuration for device and sensors

collection_serviceGetCollectionJobConfig.title: Returns a list of Collection Job Config

application_context.description: Unique handle to identify your application's collection job , serves as Key to Object on which CRUD ops are done.

output_collection_count.title: the number of output collection endpoints for given collection job(s)

input_error_collection_count.title: the number of input sensor collection endpoints for given collection job(s)

output_error_collection_count.title: the number of output collection endpoints for given collection job(s)

Return a total count of collect jobs and total collection endpoints and errors in the system if no application context
is provided.  If application context is provided counts are for that collection job

collection_serviceGetCollectionJobLifeCy.description:
GetCollectionJobStateRequest encapsulates requests for the lifetime cycle
state of associated collection jobs.

collection_life_cycle_states.description: Requested states associated to a collection job unique identifier.

result.description:
Result reply to determine any possible issue with the request or honoring
it.

application_context.description: Unique handle to identify your application's collection job , serves as Key to Object on which CRUD ops are done.

Will return all collection job operational status summary if device_id is empty for given application context
or will return on per device basis.

collection_job_status_list.title: CollectionJobStatus represents current status of the job

result.title: Sync Request reply , indicating whether request has accepted or rejected

destination_id.title: UUID of destination in crosswork inventory

collection_serviceGetIsResourceInUseRequ.title: Request to check whether a resource is in use

is_in_use.title: Whether a resource is in used or not

result.title: Sync Request reply , indicating whether request has accepted or rejected

collection_serviceGetIsResourceInUseResp.title: Response to check whether a resource is in use

collection_serviceJobDeviceSet.title: JobDeviceSet represents a list of devices or device group

collection_serviceJobLifetimeType.description:
- UNKNOWN_TEMPORAL_TYPE: Invalid Lifetime
 - APPLICATION_MANAGED: Create and Delete of Collection job is managed by Application
 - CALENDAR_MANAGED: Create and Delete of Collection job is managed by Calendaring service tied to a calendar schedule.
Not Supported as of now.
 - AUTO_DELETE_AFTER_N_SAMPLES: Auto Delete of Collection job after N Collections.
collection_serviceJobLifetimeType.title: Types of job life times supported

collection_serviceLifeCycleState.title:
LifeCycleState of collection job based on current device counts.
See: https://confluence-eng-rtp1.cisco.com/conf/display/UXSP/CreateDeleteCollectionJobs

collection_status.title: Output side  collection status per destination

collection_servicePhase.description:
- ACTIVE: Request is active , Collection  Job associated with app Context may be in any one of the above states
 - TERMINATING: Request is marked for deletion , Collection Job associated with app Context is queued for deletion
 - TERMINATION_FAILED: Request is marked for deletion , Collection Job was failed to be deleted, even in one of the devices.
 - DELETED: Request is successfully deleted from the Collection Service on all devices. This phase will only appear in bus
notifications, will not appear in GetJobStatus, as the job will be deleted from DB.
collection_servicePhase.title: Phase indicates whether Request asscociated with AppContext is Alive or marked for deletion within collection service

page_token.title:
Page token to echo back to get next page, if collection_job_device_sets is empty or page token is empty ,
then there is no more results

filter_query.title: Reserved for future use. Not used as of CW 3.1

collection_serviceRequestResult.description:
- REJECTED: Request has been rejected
 - ACCEPTED: Request has been accepted for processing
collection_serviceRequestResult.title:
Request - reply
response

request_result.description: ResultValue indicated accept/reject for a request, not the outcome of the work itself.

error.description:
Message is a textual description of reason for rejection, and can be safely passed on to operator through logs
or UI.

collection_serviceResult.description:
Result is used to convey whether an operation (individual or in a batch)
has been accepted or rejected. For sync API's an error or rejection indicates failure of operation.
A string error message accompanies rejection to support troubleshooting. For notification objects,
rejection represents failure to do intended operation.

collection_serviceSensorConfigCommitted.description: SensorConfig describing cadence from input and output side along with destination.

collection_serviceSensorInputConfig.description: SensorInputConfig  represents device side collection at some cadence.

cadence_in_millisec.description: This is the cadence at which path is collected from device to collector post optimization across all apps.

sensor_data.title: Sensor path, Every sensor path on the input side needs to have one mapping on the output side

filter_profile_id.description: Optional filter_profile_id, forward looking not used.

destination.description: Destinations a sensor data is written to.

collection_serviceSensorOutputConfig.description:
Sensor Output represents output of sensor to a destination for given sensor which is a topic on a message broker or
GRPC server.

cadence_in_millisec.description:
This is a cadence at which the data is sent out to a given destination
post optimization across all apps. Take special note that for types:
   - GNMI
The cadence will be adjusted to be the same as the lowest input
cadence due to device collection limitations.

collection_serviceStatus.description:
- NOTREADY: NOTREADY indicates that initial setup of the object is in progress,
or being retried.
 - READY: READY indicates that initial setup of the object is complete and
collection organised. Status moves to READY only on success across all devices.
 - FAILED: An unrecoverable failure has occurred, associated with the object. Status moves to FAILED , even if one of the
devices within request encountered failure.
collection_serviceStatus.title: State of async Object App Context within the collection service with respect operational state on one or more devices

device_package.title: Total size  is limited to 512 characters

heartbeat_interval.description:
Specifies the maximum allowable silent period in nanoseconds when
suppress_redundant is in use. The target should send a value at least once
in the period specified.

use_models.description:
The set of schemas that define the elements of the data tree that should
be sent by the target.

updates_only.description:
An optional field to specify that only updates to current state should be
sent to a client. If set, the initial state is not sent to the client but
rather only the sync message followed by any subsequent updates to the
current state. For ONCE and POLL modes, this causes the server to send only
the sync message (Sec. 3.5.2.3).

common_collection_dataGNMIDeviceSetting.title: Device settings that may or may not be supported for GNMI

device_package.title: Total size  is limited to 512 characters

application_names.title:
Empty list will result in all syslog messages getting collected
If multiple items are present in the same list type, as long as any one matches, messages would be collected.
Optional list of ApplicationName's to filter upon

process_names.description:
Empty list will result in all syslog messages getting collected
Optional list of  process_names to filter upon
If multiple items are present in the same list type, as long as any one matches, messages would be collected.

common_collection_dataSyslogSensor.title:
Refer https://www.paessler.com/it-explained/syslog,https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/rfc5424/
Example if PRI is (165,111) , application_name is  (su,syslogd) all messages with PRI (165 or 111) and application
name su or syslogd would be collected

gnmiModelData.title:
ModelData is used to describe a set of schema modules. It can be used in a
CapabilityResponse where a target reports the set of modules that it
supports, and within the SubscribeRequest and GetRequest messages to specify
the set of models from which data tree elements should be reported.
Reference: gNMI Specification Section 3.2.3

element.description:
Elements of the path are no longer encoded as a string, but rather within
the elem field as a PathElem message.

gnmiPath.description:
Path encodes a data tree path as a series of repeated strings, with
each element of the path representing a data tree node name and the
associated attributes.
Reference: gNMI Specification Section 2.2.2.

gnmiPathElem.description:
PathElem encodes an element of a gNMI path, along with any attributes (keys)
that may be associated with it.
Reference: gNMI Specification Section 2.2.2.

gnmiQOSMarking.title:
QOSMarking specifies the DSCP value to be set on transmitted telemetry
updates from the target.
Reference: gNMI Specification Section 3.5.1.2

gnmiSubscriptionMode.title:
SubscriptionMode is the mode of the subscription, specifying how the
target must return values in a subscription.
Reference: gNMI Specification Section 3.5.1.3
